personal.name: Aniket Poojari
personal.title: AI/ML Engineer
personal.subtitle: Agentic AI Systems | LLM Applications (RAG, Fine-Tuning, Guardrails) | Scalable MLOps Pipelines
bio: AI/ML Engineer with 3+ years of experience building Agentic AI systems, LLM applications, and scalable MLOps pipelines.
Delivered measurable impact: 66% faster support resolution via RAG chatbot, 3x distributed training speedup on SageMaker, 40% LLM cost reduction through model routing.
Specialized in MCP, Guardrails, Red-Teaming, Fine-Tuning (LoRA/PEFT), and distributed training with DeepSpeed.
Focused on shipping production-ready AI that is fast, reliable, and impossible to ignore.

projects.title: Enterprise AI Assistant with MCP
projects.description: An agentic NL-to-SQL assistant using Model Context Protocol (MCP) with 3 registered tools (query, chart, report), achieving 100% agent routing accuracy and 80% SQL accuracy. Features multi-layer Input/Output Guardrails blocking 99.5% of adversarial inputs (prompt injection, PII filtering, SQL injection prevention, output data masking). Includes per-request token analytics and cost-tracking service that identified 25% cost-saving opportunities through model caching.

projects.title: LLM Evaluation & Red-Teaming Platform
projects.description: Full-stack platform to red-team LLMs with 216 adversarial attacks across 6 categories (Injection, PII, Jailbreak, Bias, Hallucination, Harmful Content). Implements statistical A/B testing using paired t-tests and bootstrap CI, providing 95% confidence intervals and effect sizes for model comparisons. Reduced evaluation latency by 60% through parallel batch processing and SSE-based real-time progress streaming. Built with React frontend and FastAPI backend with SQLite (9 tables) for comprehensive observability.

projects.title: Agentic AI Research Assistant
projects.description: An autonomous research agent with a self-reflection loop built using LangGraph, FastAPI, and Groq. The system operates through a cyclical Generate-Critique-Refine workflow — producing responses from Tavily/DuckDuckGo web search, assessing every claim against retrieved evidence, and re-searching when confidence falls below 0.7. Includes a comparative benchmarking suite (agent vs. baseline LLM) and Ragas-based evaluation measuring faithfulness, relevancy, context precision, and recall — achieving a 1.0 faithfulness score by grounding all responses in verified web evidence.

projects.title: BiLoRA: Dual Adapter Fine-Tuning
projects.description: End-to-end MLOps system fine-tuning Microsoft Phi-3-mini-4k-instruct (3.8B) with two specialized LoRA adapters — one targeting attention layers for code generation (MBPP), another targeting MLP layers for docstring generation (CodeXGLUE). Uses 4-bit NF4 quantization, DVC pipelines, a Groq LLM-as-judge benchmarking quality gate that blocks deployment on metric regression, CI/CD auto-deploy to HF Spaces, and a human-in-the-loop feedback loop storing user ratings to a HF Dataset for continuous retraining.

projects.title: Multi-Modal RAG QA System
projects.description: Production-style RAG application that ingests PDFs (text + tables via PyMuPDF + Tabula) and websites (BeautifulSoup4), chunks and embeds content with all-MiniLM-L6-v2 into ChromaDB, and answers queries via Groq LLaMA 3.1. Detects cross-document comparative questions and balances retrieval across sources. Each response shows inline latency, chunks retrieved, and token usage. Thumbs-up/down feedback is stored in a HF Dataset, with a Streamlit monitoring dashboard visualizing latency trends, token costs, and retrieval quality.

projects.title: Text-to-Image Diffusion Model (From Scratch)
projects.description: Latent diffusion pipeline built from scratch with three core components: CLIP for text-to-embedding conversion, VAE for image compression/reconstruction, and a Cross-Attentional UNet for iterative denoising. Trained on 8K image-caption pairs using DeepSpeed distributed training on AWS SageMaker with mixed-precision optimization. Workflow orchestrated by Apache Airflow with MLflow on DagsHub for experiment tracking, model versioning, and loss monitoring.

projects.title: Monocular Depth Estimation
projects.description: DPT model (ViT-Base/16 encoder + convolutional fusion decoder) predicting metric depth from single RGB images on Cityscapes (max depth 80m). Trained with scale-invariant + gradient loss, differential learning rates (1e-5 ViT / 1e-4 decoder), AMP, cosine LR warmup, and early stopping. 6-stage DVC pipeline: preprocessing → training → evaluate → conditional model promotion (MLflow) → ONNX export → push to HF Hub. Gradio demo auto-deployed to HF Spaces via GitHub Actions using ONNX Runtime for CPU inference.

projects.title: Automated Stock Price Prediction
projects.description: CNN-based stock price prediction system with dynamic indicator selection via XGBoost feature engineering. Fetches historical data from Yahoo Finance API, performs comprehensive EDA, and trains models tracked via MLflow with DVC pipeline orchestration.

projects.title: Lane Segmentation
projects.description: Semantic segmentation for lane detection in road images using pre-trained architectures from segmentation-models-pytorch. Custom LaneDataset class with horizontal flip augmentation, trained on 224x224 images normalized with ImageNet statistics. Achieves 80% IoU for autonomous driving lane detection.

projects.title: Motor Self Inspection
projects.description: A web app that detects vehicle damages for faster insurance claim approvals using Mask R-CNN for damage detection.

projects.title: Image Denoising
projects.description: Variational autoencoder for image denoising, reconstructing clean images from noisy inputs.

projects.title: NYC Taxi Trip Duration Prediction
projects.description: Prediction system estimating taxi trip durations in NYC using CatBoost with XGBoost-assisted feature selection.

projects.title: Texture Generation (DC-GAN)
projects.description: Designed and implemented a DC-GAN to generate realistic textures from scratch.

projects.title: Russian-to-English Translation
projects.description: Encoder-decoder model with attention mechanism for Russian-to-English text translation.

projects.title: Human-Computer Interaction (Gestures + Voice)
projects.description: Interactive system enabling computer control using hand gestures and voice commands. Published in IEEE Xplore.

projects.title: Cricket Shot Classification
projects.description: Keypoint R-CNN (pretrained on COCO) extracts body keypoints, which train a neural network for classifying cricket shot poses.

projects.title: Text Summarization GPT from Scratch
projects.description: Custom 125M-parameter GPT model pretrained and fine-tuned on the XSum dataset using teacher forcing. Two-phase training pipeline with 128-token context window, orchestrated via DVC with MLflow experiment tracking. Achieved ROUGE-L score of 0.54 on validation.

highlights: Architecting predictive demand forecasting for 8,000+ SKUs using XGBoost and Time-Series analysis, targeting a 15% reduction in inventory carrying costs across regional distribution centers
Building high-volume data ingestion pipelines and SQL-based statistical models to automate 90% of manual restocking logic for multi-warehouse distribution
Developing a real-time supply chain dashboard with route clustering to optimize logistics efficiency by 20% and reduce regional shipping delays

Built a Python pipeline to clean and transform brainwave recordings into features and trained machine learning models to predict which movement a person is imagining (left hand, right hand, foot, tongue) from EEG signals

Developed reusable Python tools to load, standardize, and label brainwave data from OpenBCI headsets and public datasets, creating training/evaluation datasets and iterating on baseline classifiers to improve imagined-movement detection accuracy
Led deployment of a secure on-premise RAG chatbot and LLM infrastructure, reducing internal support ticket resolution time from 3 days to 1 day while ensuring complete enterprise data privacy

Engineered a scalable full-stack MOOC platform using a TypeScript monorepo with 4 microservices; built secure REST APIs (Express, MongoDB, S3) and modern React frontends (Redux Toolkit, TanStack Query), enabling course delivery, progress tracking, threaded comments, and automated certificate generation via Puppeteer
Supported ML and Cloud Computing courses by building and maintaining PyTorch/Scikit-learn lab environments on GCP and Colab for 300+ students, ensuring smooth execution of experiments
Refactored and standardized 15+ lab notebooks with version control and reproducible pipelines, streamlining grading and reducing student runtime errors by 35%
Built ML pipelines for block-trade allocation and forecasting, cutting allocation error rates by 15% and improving forecast accuracy by 20%
Automated data infrastructure using Docker and PostgreSQL, increasing data retrieval speed by 75% and reducing system downtime by 30%
Leveraged Apache Spark to analyze gigabytes of trading data, detecting discrepancies and boosting strategy testing accuracy by 50%
Implemented automated trade-cleansing workflows (Random Forest, XGBoost), cutting manual workload by 30% and enhancing model reliability by 25%
Automated vehicle damage detection in insurance claims by training a Mask R-CNN model, raising detection accuracy by 18% and cutting manual claim processing by 45%
Integrated ML workflows into the Django-based claims system, reducing overall claim processing time by 35%

testimonials.name: Vivek Kashyap
testimonials.content: Aniket is well focused, hardworking as well as a solution oriented guy. In his term of internship he and team has solved the assigned problem very well before the given timeline. The assigned project was designed and developed by them as expected and meeting all the requirements. I'll highly recommend him, he is good team contributor, very productive, good and can be great problem solver. Best Wishes
